column2: Nozibele put her hand to her neck. She had forgotten her necklace! "Please come back with me!" she begged her friends. But her friends said it was too late. Nozibele went back to the river alone. She found her necklace and began hurrying home. But
column3: she got lost in the dark. In the distance she saw light coming from a hut. She walked quickly towards it and knocked at the door. To her surprise
column4: a dog opened the door and said
column5: "What do you want?" "I'm lost and I need a place to sleep
column7: or I'll bite you!" said the dog. Nozibele went in. The dog said
column8: "Cook for me!" "But I've never cooked for a dog before
column10: or I'll bite you!" said the dog. Nozibele cooked some food for the dog. Then the dog said
column11: "Make the bed for me!" Nozibele answered
column12: "I've never made a bed for a dog." "Make the bed
column13: or I'll bite you!" the dog said. Nozibele made the bed. Every day she had to cook and sweep and wash for the dog.
